title: Tlingit language
summary: The Tlingit language (/ˈklɪŋkɪt, -ɡɪt/ KLING-kit, -⁠git;[5] Lingít [ɬɪ̀nkɪ́tʰ])[6] is spoken by the Tlingit people of Southeast Alaska and Western Canada and is a branch of the Na-Dene language family. Extensive effort is being put into revitalization programs in Southeast Alaska to revive and preserve the Tlingit language and culture.
